title: A cool start to a blog site!

content.heading: What this site will be
content.content: This site will be my attempt at organizing all of my projects and to show it off to people easly. Essentually a digital portfolio of sorts.

content.heading: When things will happen
content.content: As I bounce between projects and find myself busy in life, I am aiming to be completing more projects by the end of this month. This website just happens to be one of mine. I really want to try to be a part of Pirate Software's game jam on July 17th, but I know imma have 2 days of downtime on that day. Lets see what I can do, even if I don't make the time frame.

content.heading: Happy 4th of July!
content.content: Todays the freedom day! Gonna relax, clear my thoughts, and celibrate independence day!

content.heading: Practicing my independence
content.content: Just going to spend the next couple of days not hooked into making things or being busy. I definitly need it because I have massive goals that take heavy thought into how I spend my time.

content.heading: Inital thoughts
content.content: I loved the fact that GoLang could export to a executable binary, so I wanted to learn it. However, I kept on getting too technical with it and end up not making anything I wanted.

content.heading: Technical stuff
content.content: I would make my code as explicit as possable, as low level as possable, and overall not making anything because I would get myself stuck on something that wouldn't help me make anything. With making a post editor and just generally coding for this website, I have learned to take a step back and build what I need to build first, then make the code better later.

content.heading: Conclusion
content.content: Tldr: Focus on making something with code, then optimizing later. Keep it simple and stupid. Don't worry about not repeating yourself, fix it later.
